Boris Johnson ceasing to be prime minister of the UK before the 18th of September seems implausible. While there is a current uproar about the UK's role in the situation in Afghanistan, it does not appear to be targeted directly at Boris beyond the fact that he was on holiday during the events and did not recall parliament before the fall of Kabul. Dominic Raab has taken at least as much flack. Boris can, at the very least, extend his stay in number 10 with his cabinet reshuffle that will give the impression of doing something. The current crisis in Afghanistan aside, Boris' ratings have taken a big dip but he still remains preferred to Keir Starmer as PM by the British public. Likewise, the conservatives are still ahead in the Westminster voting intention polls. With no conservative MP likely to be able to brand themselves as a better election winner than Boris, it seems extremely unlikely that Boris will cease to be PM in the near future.
I give up.
